about


I am an incoming PhD student in the biostatistics department at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. You can find me on LinkedIn and Github.

I did my bachelor’s at the University of Chicago and graduated in 2016 with a double major in math and statistics. I then worked for a year as a research assistant for Professor Guenter Hitsch and Professor Bradley Shapiro at the Booth School of Business before enrolling at Johns Hopkins.
